title: Weakness in Apple Could Gain Traction in September
text:
Shares of Apple ( AAPL ) were lower in pre-market activity following President Trump's move to boost tariffs on China-made goods that include some of its key products. The company has also sent out invitations for a September 10th event, at which the media expects an announcement for new iPhones and maybe pricing details for its subscription television service.

Lot's of excitement and details to focus on but let's take a deep breadth and check out the charts for this Real Money Stock of the Day.

In this daily bar chart of AAPL, below, we can see that some of our technical indicators weakened in the past month. Prices have moved sideways to slightly higher testing the cresting 50-day moving average line.

Trading volume has declined and the On-Balance-Volume (OBV) line has moved sideways.

The Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) oscillator is barely above the zero line with the two moving averages that make up the indicator right on top of each other. This suggests little in the way of "trend strength".

In this weekly bar chart of AAPL, below, we can see a weak set-up. Prices are above the slightly rising 40-week moving average line. Trading volume has declined.

The weekly OBV line has been soft the past four months and the MACD oscillator has narrowed towards a bearish crossover.

In this Point and Figure chart of AAPL, below, we can see a potential upside price target of $247 but we can also see that a trade at $199.42 will probably weaken this chart.

Bottom line strategy: Remembering the Wall Street adage that it is not the news that is important but rather how a stock reacts to the news, I would take a defensive position with AAPL this month.
